author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: وَيَسْتَقِيمَ بِهِ رِجْلِيْ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الَّذِيْ لَمْ تَزَلْ كُنْتَ مُقْتَدِرًا بِمَشِيَّتِكَ وَمُرِيدًا بِإِرادَتِكَ لا يَمْنَعُكَ عَنْ أَمْرِكَ مَنْ فِيْ أَرْضِكَ وَسَمائِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ فَارْحَمْنِي بِجُودِكَ وَكَرَمِكَ، ثُمَّ أَسْمِعْنِي نَغَماتِ الطُّيُورِ الَّتِي يُغَرِّدْنَ بِثَنآءِ نَفْسِكَ عَلَى أَفنانِ سِدْرَةِ فَرْدَانِيَّتِكَ،
translation: Thou art He Who from everlasting was, through the potency of His might, supreme over all things, and, through the operation of His will, was able to ordain all things. Nothing whatsoever, whether in Thy heaven or on Thy earth, can frustrate Thy purpose. Have mercy, then, upon me, O my Lord, through Thy gracious providence and generosity, and incline mine ear to the sweet melodies of the birds that warble their praise of Thee, amidst the branches of the tree of Thy oneness.
